greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Bitwise-XOR of exponents of prime factors of A108951(n), where A108951 is fully multiplicative with a(prime(i)) = prime(i)# = Product_{i=1..i} A000040(i).
comment: Positions of records are: 1, 2, 4, 6, 16, 24, 36, 54, 256, 384, 576, 864, 1296, 1944, 2916, 4374, 65536, ..., conjectured also to be the positions of the first occurrence of each n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to primorial numbers
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 18 2019
